Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Primary Tumor Resection in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with histologically confirmed mCRC, unresectable metastases, and minimal symptoms were randomised

Participants.evidence: Patients with histologically confirmed mCRC, unresectable metastases, and minimal symptoms

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either systemic treatment only or PTR followed by systemic treatment

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of PTR on 60-day mortality.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between August 2012 and December 2019, 196 patients were randomised, with 98 assigned to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, 60-day mortality was 3% (95% CI, 1%-9%) in the systemic treatment group and 11% (95% CI, 6%-19%) in the PTR group

Result_Outcome.evidence: 60-day mortality was 3% (95% CI, 1%-9%) in the systemic treatment group and 11% (95% CI, 6%-19%) in the PTR group (P = .03)

Harms.evidence: Patients with elevated serum levels of lactate dehydrogenase, aspartate aminotransferase, alanine aminotransferase, and/or neutrophils had significantly higher mortality in the PTR group.
